ground_truth: Thorwald is at the door, unlocking it with his key. Lisa dashes back into the bedroom just in time to avoid being seen by Thorwald as he opens the door and enters the apartment. Stella is staring out, tense and frightened, while a policeman on the phone repeats with irritation. Her expression changes sharply as she glances slightly to the left. The first policeman indicates that Lisa is to come with him and pauses momentarily to tell the second policeman to take a statement from Thorwald about the attempted burglary. The second policeman reaches for the jewelry in Thorwald’s hand and takes it for examination. During a brief pause while the two policemen speak, Lisa starts waving her left hand behind her back. Jeff is looking through his camera, and Lisa stops waving and holds her fingers spread out, pointing to the wedding ring on her left hand. The lens pans upward and across, bringing Thorwald's profile into view as he looks down at Lisa's hands. He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling someone who is watching him. Jeff drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries from the window, turning off lights, while Jeff backs his chair into the room. As Thorwald's attention is drawn back to the second policeman to answer further questions, the first policeman takes Lisa by the arm and leads her out of the apartment. Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets, and Stella moves to get it. She finds a billfold and hands it to Jeff, who takes it, extracts some bills, and begins counting the money. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting as she comments. Jeff does, as Stella gets her purse. Thorwald leaves his apartment and proceeds down the corridor. Stella goes up to the door, and Jeff grabs it, picking it up. Stella pauses, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he sees. Thorwald's apartment is completely dark, but Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible. Jeff still doesn't speak and moves forward a couple of steps. He grips the flash holder more tightly, lifting it slightly as if prepared to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, eyes on Jeff and hands clenching as he tries to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Thorwald is at the entryway, unlocking it with his key. Lisa sprints back into the chamber just in time to avoid being noticed by Thorwald as he opens the entryway and enters the flat. Stella is staring out, tense and frightened, while a constable on the phone repeats with irritation. Her expression alters sharply as she glances slightly to the left. The first constable indicates that Lisa is to come with him and pauses momentarily to tell the second constable to take an account from Thorwald about the attempted burglary. The second constable reaches for the adornments in Thorwald’s hand and takes it for examination. During a brief pause while the two constables speak, Lisa starts waving her left hand behind her back. Jeff is looking through his camera, and Lisa stops waving and holds her fingers spread out, indicating to the wedding band on her left hand. The lens pans upward and across, bringing Thorwald's silhouette into view as he looks down at Lisa's hands. He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling someone who is watching him. Jeff drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries from the window, turning off lights, while Jeff backs his chair into the room. As Thorwald's attention is drawn back to the second constable to answer further inquiries, the first constable takes Lisa by the arm and leads her out of the flat. Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets, and Stella moves to get it. She finds a wallet and hands it to Jeff, who takes it, extracts some notes, and begins counting the cash. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting as she comments. Jeff does, as Stella gets her handbag. Thorwald leaves his flat and proceeds down the passageway. Stella goes up to the entryway, and Jeff grabs it, picking it up. Stella pauses, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's flat, puzzled by what he sees. Thorwald's flat is completely dark, but Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible. Jeff still doesn't speak and moves forward a couple of steps. He grips the flash holder more tightly, lifting it slightly as if prepared to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, eyes on Jeff and hands clenching as he tries to control his rage.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Thorwald is at the door, and the key is being used by him to unlock it. Lisa dashes back into the bedroom just in time to avoid being seen by Thorwald as the door is opened and the apartment is entered by him. Stella stares out, tense and frightened, while a policeman on the phone repeats with irritation. Her expression changes sharply as she glances slightly to the left. The first policeman indicates that Lisa is to come with him and pauses momentarily to tell the second policeman to take a statement from Thorwald about the attempted burglary. The jewelry in Thorwald’s hand is reached for by the second policeman, who takes it for examination. During a brief pause while the two policemen speak, Lisa starts waving her left hand behind her back. Jeff looks through his camera, and Lisa stops waving and holds her fingers spread out, pointing to the wedding ring on her left hand. The lens is panned upward and across, bringing Thorwald's profile into view as he looks down at Lisa's hands. He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that someone who is watching him is being signaled by Lisa. The camera is dropped into Jeff's lap as Stella hurries from the window, turning off lights, while his chair is backed by Jeff into the room. As the second policeman draws Thorwald's attention back to answer further questions, Lisa is taken by the arm by the first policeman, who leads her out of the apartment. Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets, and Stella moves to get it. A billfold is found by her and handed to Jeff, who takes it, extracts some bills, and begins counting the money. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting as she comments. Jeff does, as Stella gets her purse. Thorwald leaves his apartment and proceeds down the corridor. The door is approached by Stella, and it is grabbed by Jeff, who picks it up. Stella pauses, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he sees. The apartment is completely dark, but at the top of the stairs Thorwald is somewhat visible. Jeff still doesn't speak and moves forward a couple of steps. The flash holder is gripped more tightly by him, lifting it slightly as if prepared to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, eyes on Jeff and hands clenching as he tries to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Thorwald unlocks the door with his key. Lisa quickly retreats to the bedroom, avoiding Thorwald as he enters. Stella, tense and frightened, watches while a policeman irritably repeats on the phone. Her expression shifts as she glances left. The first policeman signals Lisa to accompany him and instructs the second policeman to take Thorwald's statement about the attempted burglary. The second policeman examines the jewelry in Thorwald’s hand. During a pause, Lisa discreetly waves her left hand, pointing to her wedding ring. The camera lens pans to Thorwald's profile as he notices Lisa signaling someone. Jeff drops the camera as Stella turns off lights, and Jeff backs his chair. Thorwald's attention returns to the second policeman, and the first policeman escorts Lisa out. Jeff points to a drawer, and Stella retrieves a billfold, handing it to Jeff, who counts the money. He glances at Stella, then continues counting as she comments. Thorwald leaves his apartment and heads down the corridor. Stella approaches the door, and Jeff picks it up, pausing as he observes Thorwald's dark apartment. Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs, partially visible. Jeff moves forward, gripping the flash holder, ready to use it. Thorwald advances, eyes on Jeff, trying to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Thorwald unlocks the door with his key. Lisa dashes into the bedroom, avoiding Thorwald as he enters. Stella, tense and frightened, watches while a policeman irritably repeats on the phone. Her expression changes as she glances left. The first policeman signals Lisa to come and tells the second to take Thorwald's statement about the attempted burglary. The second policeman examines jewelry from Thorwald. During their conversation, Lisa waves her left hand, pointing to her wedding ring. The lens pans to Thorwald's profile as he notices Lisa signaling someone watching him. Jeff drops the camera, and Stella turns off lights as Jeff backs into the room. Thorwald's attention returns to the second policeman, and the first leads Lisa out. Jeff points to a drawer, and Stella retrieves a billfold, handing it to Jeff, who counts the money. He looks at Stella, then continues counting as she comments. Thorwald leaves his apartment, and Stella approaches the door. Jeff grabs it, and Stella pauses as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's dark apartment. Thorwald steps to the stairs, visible, and Jeff grips the flash holder, ready to use it. Thorwald advances, eyes on Jeff, trying to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Thorwald stands at the door, methodically unlocking it with his key. Meanwhile, Lisa makes a quick dash back into the bedroom, managing to do so just in the nick of time to avoid being seen by Thorwald as he opens the door and steps into the apartment. Stella, on the other hand, is staring out with a tense and frightened expression, while a policeman on the phone repeats his words with growing irritation. Her expression shifts dramatically as she glances slightly to the left. The first policeman gestures that Lisa is to accompany him and pauses briefly to instruct the second policeman to take a statement from Thorwald regarding the attempted burglary. The second policeman reaches out for the jewelry in Thorwald’s hand, taking it for closer examination. During a brief pause in the conversation between the two policemen, Lisa begins to wave her left hand discreetly behind her back. Jeff, who is observing through his camera, sees Lisa stop waving and hold her fingers spread out, pointing to the wedding ring on her left hand. The camera lens pans upward and across, capturing Thorwald's profile as he looks down at Lisa's hands. He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling to someone who is watching him. Jeff quickly drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries away from the window, turning off the lights, while Jeff maneuvers his chair back into the room. As Thorwald's attention is redirected to the second policeman to answer more questions, the first policeman takes Lisa by the arm and escorts her out of the apartment. Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets, prompting Stella to move to retrieve it. She finds a billfold and hands it to Jeff, who takes it, extracts some bills, and begins counting the money. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting as she makes a comment. Jeff continues as Stella retrieves her purse. Thorwald exits his apartment and proceeds down the corridor. Stella approaches the door, and Jeff grabs it, picking it up. Stella pauses, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he observes. Thorwald's apartment is shrouded in darkness, but Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible. Jeff remains silent and moves forward a couple of steps. He grips the flash holder more tightly, lifting it slightly as if he is prepared to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, his eyes fixed on Jeff, and his hands clenching as he struggles to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Thorwald stands resolutely at the door, meticulously unlocking it with his key in a deliberate and unhurried manner. Meanwhile, Lisa makes a hurried and urgent dash back into the safety of the bedroom, managing to do so just in the nick of time to remain hidden from Thorwald's view as he methodically opens the door and steps purposefully into the apartment. Stella, on the other hand, is staring out with a tense and frightened expression etched on her face, while a policeman on the telephone line repeats his words with mounting frustration and growing irritation. Her expression shifts dramatically as she glances slightly to the left, reacting to an unseen development. The first policeman gestures assertively, indicating that Lisa is to accompany him, and pauses briefly to instruct the second policeman to take a comprehensive statement from Thorwald regarding the attempted burglary. The second policeman extends his hand towards the jewelry in Thorwald’s possession, taking it for a closer and more detailed examination. During a brief pause in the ongoing conversation between the two policemen, Lisa begins discreetly waving her left hand behind her back in a subtle yet deliberate manner. Jeff, keenly observing through his camera, sees Lisa stop waving and conspicuously hold her fingers spread out, pointing directly to the wedding ring on her left hand. The camera lens pans upward and across, capturing Thorwald's profile as he looks down at Lisa's hands with curiosity. He then slowly turns his head and fixes his gaze directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling to someone who is intently watching him. Jeff quickly drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries away from the window, promptly turning off the lights, while Jeff skillfully maneuvers his wheelchair back into the room. As Thorwald's attention is redirected to the second policeman to answer additional questions, the first policeman takes Lisa by the arm and escorts her gently but firmly out of the apartment. Jeff points to a specific drawer in the wall cabinets, prompting Stella to move promptly to retrieve it. She finds a billfold and hands it to Jeff, who takes it and methodically extracts some bills, beginning to count the money carefully. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting, as she makes a comment. Jeff continues counting while Stella retrieves her purse. Thorwald exits his apartment and proceeds down the corridor with a determined stride. Stella approaches the door, and Jeff grasps it, picking it up with purpose. Stella pauses for a moment, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he observes. Thorwald's apartment is shrouded in deep darkness, yet Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible in the dim light. Jeff remains silent and moves forward a couple of steps cautiously. He grips the flash holder more tightly, lifting it slightly as if he is fully prepared to use it if necessary. Thorwald advances steadily to the middle of the room, his eyes fixed intensely on Jeff, and his hands clenching as he struggles valiantly to control his simmering anger.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Thorwald approaches the door, carefully inserting his key into the lock and turning it to unlock the door. As he begins to open the door and step inside the apartment, Lisa quickly and quietly dashes back into the bedroom, ensuring she is out of sight just in time to avoid being seen by Thorwald. Meanwhile, Stella stands by the window, her eyes wide with tension and fear, while a policeman on the phone repeats his words with growing irritation. Stella's expression shifts dramatically as she glances slightly to the left, catching sight of something that changes her demeanor. The first policeman gestures towards Lisa, indicating that she should accompany him, and pauses briefly to instruct the second policeman to take a statement from Thorwald regarding the attempted burglary. The second policeman reaches out and takes the jewelry from Thorwald's hand for further examination. During a brief lull in the conversation between the two policemen, Lisa discreetly begins waving her left hand behind her back. Jeff, peering through his camera, observes Lisa's actions, prompting her to stop waving and instead hold her fingers spread out, drawing attention to the wedding ring on her left hand. The camera lens pans upward and across, capturing Thorwald's profile as he notices Lisa's hands and slowly turns his head to look directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling to someone who is watching him. In response, Jeff quickly drops the camera into his lap as Stella rushes away from the window, turning off the lights, while Jeff maneuvers his chair backward into the room. As Thorwald's focus shifts back to the second policeman to answer more questions, the first policeman gently takes Lisa by the arm and escorts her out of the apartment. Jeff gestures towards a drawer in the wall cabinets, prompting Stella to move and retrieve it. She locates a billfold and hands it to Jeff, who takes it, pulls out some bills, and begins counting the money. He glances sharply at Stella before returning to his task as she makes a comment. Jeff continues his actions as Stella retrieves her purse. Thorwald exits his apartment and makes his way down the corridor. Stella approaches the door, and Jeff quickly grabs it, picking it up. Stella pauses momentarily, and Jeff hangs up just as he looks towards Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he observes. The apartment is shrouded in darkness, yet Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs, partially visible. Jeff remains silent, moving forward a couple of steps, and grips the flash holder more tightly, raising it slightly as if ready to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, his eyes fixed on Jeff, his hands clenching as he struggles to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Thorwald unlocks and enters his apartment, prompting Lisa to dash back into the bedroom to avoid being seen. Stella, tense and frightened, watches as a policeman irritably repeats himself on the phone. Her expression shifts as she glances left. The first policeman signals Lisa to accompany him and instructs the second policeman to take Thorwald's statement about the attempted burglary. The second policeman examines the jewelry in Thorwald’s hand. During a brief exchange between the policemen, Lisa discreetly signals Jeff by waving her left hand and pointing to her wedding ring. Jeff, observing through his camera, captures Thorwald's profile as he notices Lisa's signaling and realizes someone is watching him. Jeff lowers the camera, and Stella quickly turns off the lights as Jeff maneuvers his chair back into the room. As Thorwald is distracted by the second policeman's questions, the first policeman escorts Lisa out. Jeff directs Stella to a drawer, from which she retrieves a billfold. Jeff takes it, counts the money, and exchanges a glance with Stella as she comments and retrieves her purse. Thorwald exits his apartment and heads down the corridor. Stella approaches the door, and Jeff secures it, pausing to observe Thorwald's darkened apartment. Thorwald becomes visible at the top of the stairs, prompting Jeff to grip his flash holder tightly, ready to use it. Thorwald advances into the room, eyes fixed on Jeff, struggling to control his anger.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Thorwald is at the door, unlocking it with his key, a routine he follows every evening after returning from his job at the local factory, known for its round-the-clock shifts. Lisa dashes back into the bedroom just in time to avoid being seen by Thorwald, who has recently become the subject of neighborhood gossip due to his strange nocturnal activities, as he opens the door and enters the apartment. Stella is staring out, tense and frightened, while a policeman on the phone repeats with irritation, calling in to report the incident from the precinct known for its high volume of petty crimes. Her expression changes sharply as she glances slightly to the left, noticing a photograph on the wall that had been inexplicably moved. The first policeman indicates that Lisa is to come with him and pauses momentarily to tell the second policeman to take a statement from Thorwald about the attempted burglary that had startled the usually quiet building. The second policeman reaches for the jewelry in Thorwald’s hand, valuable evidence that he takes for examination, suspecting it might connect to the string of thefts in the area. During a brief pause while the two policemen speak, Lisa starts waving her left hand behind her back, a prearranged signal she and Jeff had devised in case of an emergency. Jeff is looking through his camera, a top-of-the-line model he bought after his photography exhibit gained local acclaim, and Lisa stops waving and holds her fingers spread out, pointing to the wedding ring on her left hand, subtly communicating an urgent message to Jeff. The lens pans upward and across, bringing Thorwald's profile into view as he looks down at Lisa's hands. He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens, suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling someone who is watching him from the apartment across the courtyard. Jeff drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries from the window, turning off lights with practiced efficiency, while Jeff backs his chair into the room. As Thorwald's attention is drawn back to the second policeman to answer further questions, the first policeman takes Lisa by the arm and leads her out of the apartment, ensuring her safety away from the potential danger. Jeff points to a drawer in the wall cabinets, where he had earlier hidden a critical piece of evidence, and Stella moves to get it. She finds a billfold and hands it to Jeff, who takes it, extracts some bills, and begins counting the money that had been earmarked for their planned getaway. He looks up sharply at Stella, then returns to counting as she comments on the unexpected windfall. Jeff does, as Stella gets her purse, ready for a quick departure if necessary. Thorwald leaves his apartment and proceeds down the corridor, moving with a deliberate pace that belies his inner turmoil. Stella goes up to the door, and Jeff grabs it, picking it up carefully as if mindful of its creaky hinge that might give them away. Stella pauses, and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment, puzzled by what he sees. Thorwald's apartment is completely dark, but Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible, his silhouette cast by the dim corridor light. Jeff still doesn't speak and moves forward a couple of steps. He grips the flash holder more tightly, an essential tool he keeps on hand since the incident with the prowler last summer, lifting it slightly as if prepared to use it. Thorwald advances to the middle of the room, eyes on Jeff and hands clenching as he tries to control his anger, a testament to the tension that had been escalating between them over the past few weeks.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Bartleby is at the window, unlocking it with his brush. Clara crawls back into the library just in time to avoid being spotted by Bartleby as he slides the window and enters the studio. Emma is gazing out, calm and amused, while a baker on the laptop sings with joy. His expression shifts slightly as he squints slightly to the right. The first baker indicates that Clara is to dance with him and waits momentarily to tell the second baker to sing a tune for Bartleby about the successful painting. The second baker reaches for the feathers in Bartleby's pocket and pockets them for analysis. During a quick moment while the two bakers hum, Clara starts snapping her right fingers behind her head. Philip is staring through his telescope, and Clara stops snapping and holds her toes curled up, gesturing to the bracelet on her right wrist. The eyepiece slides downward and across, bringing Bartleby's silhouette into view as he glances up at Clara's feet. He then quickly turns his neck and peers directly into the eyepiece, suddenly perceiving that Clara is gesturing to someone who is listening to him. Philip drops the telescope onto his knee as Emma rushes from the doorway, turning on fans, while Philip pushes his sofa into the hall. As Bartleby's focus is pulled back to the second baker to answer additional melodies, the first baker guides Clara by the nose and leads her out of the studio. Philip gestures to a chimney in the ceiling compartments, and Emma crawls to reach it. She finds a notepad and hands it to Philip, who examines it, withdraws some sketches, and begins sorting the doodles. He glances up suddenly at Emma, then returns to organizing as she predicts. Philip continues, as Emma locates her scarf. Bartleby exits his studio and ambles down the garden. Emma strolls up to the window, and Philip retrieves it, hiding it up. Emma lingers, and he pauses just as Philip peers toward Bartleby's studio, bewildered by what he observes. Bartleby's studio is brightly lit, but Bartleby climbs to the bottom of the ladder and is barely discernible. Philip still doesn't whisper and moves backward a couple of feet. He grips the tripod more loosely, lowering it slightly as if ready to drop it. Bartleby retreats to the edge of the hall, gaze on Philip and fingers unclenching as he tries to hide his excitement.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Thorwald opens his door, just missing Lisa as she hides in the bedroom. Stella watches tensely while a policeman instructs Lisa to follow him, taking Thorwald's statement about a burglary attempt. Another officer examines jewelry in Thorwald’s hand. As Lisa signals Jeff by showing her wedding ring, Thorwald realizes she’s communicating with someone observing him. Jeff lowers his camera, and Stella turns off lights, assisting Jeff. As Thorwald responds to police questions, Lisa is escorted out. Jeff instructs Stella to retrieve a billfold, counts the money, then puzzled, watches Thorwald leave his darkened apartment. Thorwald approaches Jeff, trying to suppress his anger, and Jeff readies his flash, anticipating confrontation.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order

prepared to use it  Jeff still doesn't speak and moves forward a couple of steps  Thorwald's apartment is completely dark but Thorwald steps to the top of the stairs and is somewhat visible  Stella pauses and he hangs up just as Jeff looks toward Thorwald's apartment puzzled by what he sees  Stella goes up to the door and Jeff grabs it picking it up  Thorwald leaves his apartment and proceeds down the corridor  Jeff does as Stella gets her purse  He looks up sharply at Stella then returns to counting as she comments  She finds a billfold and hands it to Jeff who takes it extracts some Thorwald's attention is drawn back to the second policeman to answer further questions  Jeff drops the camera into his lap as Stella hurries from the window turning off lights while Jeff backs his chair into the room  He then slowly turns his head and looks directly into the lens suddenly realizing that Lisa is signaling someone who is watching him  The lens pans upward and across bringing Thorwald's profile into view as he looks down at Lisa's hands  Jeff is looking through his camera and Lisa stops waving and holds her fingers spread out pointing to the wedding ring on her left hand sharply as she glances slightly to the left  Stella is staring out tense and frightened while a policeman on the phone repeats with irritation  Lisa dashes back into the bedroom just in time to avoid being seen by Thorwald as he opens the door and enters the apartment  Thorwald is at the door unlocking it with his key
